title: March 12, 2025 Police Chase and Accident footage & Documents (St. Gabriel Police Department St.gabriel)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The footage from the dash cameras of the St. Gabriel Police Department who gave chase prior to the car accident that resulted in the deaths of Jeremiah Downing and Hunter LaGrange on LA 30 near Blubonnet Blvd March 12, 2025 in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. More specifically, all footage of the chase and the accident as well as footage from the body worn cameras of the St. Gabriel Police Department officers who gave chase at the scene of the crash on March 12, 2025.  Footage from the body worn cameras of the Louisiana State Trooper 'sTroop A officers who responded to the car accident. The accident report for the car accident involving the Camaro and GMC Sierra. The names and badge numbers of the St. Gabriel Police Department officers who gave chase in the incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Reagan Ross

title: University of Texas system drag show complaints (University of Texas, Austin)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: University of Texas system drag show complaints (University of Texas, Austin)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any Title IX (or similar) complaint or report referencing the word "in drag", "drag performance", "drag show", "drag shows", or "drag performances". This request is limited to complaints filed on or after January 1, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Adam  Steinbaugh, 
 
Thank you for registering with The University of Texas at Austin Open Records System. 
 
Your Login ID is:  183466-12565729@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://utexas.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx) 
 
Please login to "My Request Center" to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY

communications.subject: Public Information Act Request :: R008670-031925
communications.communication:
Dear Adam Steinbaugh: 
 
Thank you for your interest in the public records of The University of Texas at Austin.
Your request has been given the reference number R008670-031925 for
tracking purposes. Your request is being processed in accordance with Chapter
552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. We will respond to
you on or before 4/3/2025. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any Title IX (or similar) complaint or report referencing the word "in drag", "drag performance", "drag show", "drag shows", or "drag performances". This request is limited to complaints filed on or after January 1, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Funiversity-texas-austin-383%252Funiversity-of-texas-system-drag-show-complaints-university-of-texas-austin-183466%252F%253Femail%253Dpublicinformationrequest%252540austin.utexas.edu&url_auth_token=AAAe-OR0ycwFfrtLGzZmBg_JGy8%3A1tv5FP%3AXv0w60B6DlasyWLboKc0ALBxFjW8Vtsht_AM9aQqWYU 
PLEASE NOTE: The Public Information Act, found in Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, does not require a governmental body to create new
information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using The University of Texas at Austin Public Information Portal. 
The University of Texas at Austin 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Information Portal (https://utexas.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/CustomerIssues.aspx)
